words.defineEn: (of a meeting) having enough members present to conduct business or to make official decisions by voting
words.defineVi: (của một cuộc họp) có đủ thành viên có mặt để tiến hành kinh doanh hoặc đưa ra quyết định chính thức bằng cách biểu quyết

words.defineEn: the minimum number of people that must be present for a meeting to officially begin or for decisions to be made
words.defineVi: số lượng người tối thiểu phải có mặt để cuộc họp chính thức bắt đầu hoặc để đưa ra quyết định

examples: Railroads were also the first modern corporations.
Because they run on rails, railroads need steel.
The Railroad business was also emblematic of the partnership between the national government and industry.
Railroads and shipping timetables further required the standardization of time.
And because it is rather heavy, steel needs railroads.
words.defineEn: to unfairly compel someone or a group of people to to accept something such as a decision, rule, etc. quickly
words.defineVi: ép buộc một ai đó hoặc một nhóm người một cách không công bằng để chấp nhận một cái gì đó chẳng hạn như một quyết định, quy tắc, vv một cách nhanh chóng

examples: The documentary presented the controversial issue in a different light, challenging commonly held beliefs and inviting viewers to reconsider their opinions.
And people are really reconsidering their options.
It gave Facebook six months to reconsider.
On the next page, Amazon will ask you to reconsider.
Today, the Minnesota Court of Appeals ruled that the trial judge must reconsider a state request to add third-degree murder to the charges Chauvin faces.
words.defineEn: to think again about an opinion or decision, particularly to see if it needs changing or not
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ lại về một ý kiến hoặc quyết định, đặc biệt là để xem nó có cần thay đổi hay không

examples: There was a huge reconsideration taking place about the credibility of what we were being told by the Republican establishment.
Southerland saw her own work targeted, when she says without warning Pruitt announced a rule she helped develop to keep toxic coal waste out of the water supply was up for reconsideration.
Southerland saw her own work targeted, when she says without warning Pruitt announced a rule she helped develop to keep toxic coal waste out of the water supply was up for reconsideration.
words.defineEn: the act of thinking about an opinion or decision again, especially with an intention to change it
words.defineVi: hành động suy nghĩ lại về một ý kiến hoặc quyết định, đặc biệt là với ý định thay đổi nó

words.defineEn: (usually passive) to send a matter to someone of an authority so that it can be dealt with
words.defineVi: (thường bị động) gửi một vấn đề cho ai đó có thẩm quyền để giải quyết

examples: That resolution clearly withered on the vine.
The resolution passed both houses before the zero hour and the President signed it.
Some people set resolutions for the new year in December, hoping to make positive changes.
The United Nations Security Council has passed a resolution asking the two countries to resume peace negotiations.
When dealing with customer service, it can be helpful to be assertive and persistent, as the squeaky wheel gets the grease and is more likely to receive a satisfactory resolution.
words.defineEn: a serious decision to behave or not to behave in a certain way or to do or not to do something particular
words.defineVi: một quyết định nghiêm túc để cư xử hay không cư xử theo một cách nhất định hoặc làm hay không làm điều gì đó cụ thể

examples: Both projects are kept on ice until the question of funding is resolved.
Experts have urged ministers to take the necessary steps to resolve the issue.
I'm afraid this matter shall be resolved at the court of law, my hands are tied in this case.
They're just playing for time, hoping that the situation will resolve itself.

I learned the hard way that good accounting makes good friends after a disagreement with my roommate over unpaid bills almost ruined our friendship, but we were able to resolve the issue by keeping better track of our expenses.
words.defineEn: to make a decision with determination
words.defineVi: đưa ra quyết định với quyết tâm

examples: The team then beats a retreat from the mall, hoping no one noticed them.
Next month, I will go on a yoga retreat to recharge my batteries.
Just as a turtle retreats into its shell for protection, the turtle bean provides a nutritious and hearty meal.
Due to the impending rain we did not hang around on the summit, but instead made hasty retreat back to the van.
The man retreats inside.
words.defineEn: to allow people's negative comments and criticisms change one's mind about something
words.defineVi: cho phép những nhận xét và phê bình tiêu cực của mọi người làm thay đổi suy nghĩ của một người về điều gì đó

examples: The team then beats a retreat from the mall, hoping no one noticed them.
Next month, I will go on a yoga retreat to recharge my batteries.
Just as a turtle retreats into its shell for protection, the turtle bean provides a nutritious and hearty meal.
Due to the impending rain we did not hang around on the summit, but instead made hasty retreat back to the van.
The man retreats inside.
words.defineEn: an act of changing one's mind about something because of people's negative comments and criticisms
words.defineVi: một hành động thay đổi suy nghĩ của một người về một cái gì đó vì những nhận xét và chỉ trích tiêu cực của mọi người

words.defineEn: to declare someone guilty or innocent in a court of law
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố ai đó có tội hoặc vô tội trong một tòa án của pháp luật

examples: This reversed Euclid’s idea.
Three taps is reverse.
Also, they reversed the flow of the freaking Chicago River.
However this time, the situation was reversed.
So you did the reverse.
words.defineEn: (law) to alter a previous decision, judgment, etc. to the contrary one
words.defineVi: (luật) thay đổi một quyết định, bản án, v.v... trước đó ngược lại

words.defineEn: the act of changing an earlier promise, decision, or statement so that it becomes entirely different
words.defineVi: hành động thay đổi một lời hứa, quyết định hoặc tuyên bố trước đó để nó trở nên hoàn toàn khác

words.defineEn: to officially approve something such as a decision, resolution, etc. without proper consideration
words.defineVi: để chính thức phê duyệt một cái gì đó như một quyết định, nghị quyết, vv mà không cần xem xét thích hợp

examples: Dear Roman Senate, Whether you were rubber stamping the laws of Emperor Augustus, or stabbing Caesar on the floor of your sacred hall, you were always doing something!
And even though Congress has this authority, the way that it's worked in the past, is this kind of just a rubber stamp.
Although Augustus tried to pretend that the forms of the Roman republic were still intact, the truth was that he made the laws and the Senate had become nothing more than a rubber stamp.
words.defineEn: a person or organization that automatically approves or authorizes a plan, decision, etc. without considering it properly
words.defineVi: một người hoặc tổ chức tự động phê duyệt hoặc cho phép một kế hoạch, quyết định, v.v. mà không xem xét nó đúng cách

words.defineEn: to irrevocably make a decision or to take an action with consequences
words.defineVi: để đưa ra quyết định hoặc thực hiện một hành động không thể thay đổi với hậu quả

examples: The house rules are crystal clear.
The teacher ruled the classroom with a heavy hand, rarely allowing any freedom or creativity.
She explained the rules of the game to the new players.
In this particular society men rule the roost and women have a low status and few rights.
The new rules should help cut the red tape for farmers.
words.defineEn: to make an official decision about something
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một quyết định chính thức về một cái gì đó

examples: The judge's ruling carries significant weight in the legal community.
The judge stood firm in her ruling.
This support has dramatically tilted the balance of power in favor of the Algerian ruling elite.
Any government that seeks to split its opponents is dividing and ruling.
And Judge Amy Berman Jackson's ruling does have some pretty strong language about the Justice Department.
words.defineEn: a decision made by someone with official power, particularly a judge
words.defineVi: một quyết định được đưa ra bởi một người có quyền lực chính thức, đặc biệt là một thẩm phán

examples: The incident says an awful lot about his character.
The clock says ten past two.
His angry glance said it all.
To say a prayer.
The clock said three o'clock.
words.defineEn: the right or chance to give an opinion about something
words.defineVi: quyền hoặc cơ hội để đưa ra ý kiến về một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to decide or choose something after considering all possible alternatives
words.defineVi: để quyết định hoặc chọn một cái gì đó sau khi xem xét tất cả các lựa chọn thay thế có thể

words.defineEn: to refrain from making a decision by postponing it until the next day
words.defineVi: kiềm chế không đưa ra quyết định bằng cách hoãn lại cho đến ngày hôm sau

words.defineEn: unable to choose because there are a lot of choices
words.defineVi: không thể chọn vì có rất nhiều sự lựa chọn

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
The guard stood straight as a ramrod.
They clicked straight away.
He gives it to you straight.
Sometimes he spoke straight from the shoulder and sometimes in puzzles
words.defineEn: (of a choice or competition) obvious and only involving two things or people
words.defineVi: (của một sự lựa chọn hoặc cạnh tranh) rõ ràng và chỉ liên quan đến hai điều hoặc người

words.defineEn: to undertake an action even though one might fail
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hành động mặc dù một người có thể thất bại

words.defineEn: to consider something when trying to make a judgment or decision
words.defineVi: để xem xét một cái gì đó khi cố gắng đưa ra một bản án hoặc quyết định

words.defineEn: to give thought to a certain fact before making a decision
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một thực tế nhất định trước khi đưa ra quyết định

words.defineEn: to give something adequate amount of thought and consideration before making a decision or forming an opinion about it
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một cái gì đó đủ lượng suy nghĩ và cân nhắc trước khi đưa ra quyết định hoặc hình thành một ý kiến về nó

examples: The chef tasted the sauce with a small spoon.
The pith of the citrus fruit added a bitter taste to the juice.
The sauce would kill the taste of the herbs.
Too much garlic killed the taste of the meat.
The cake tasted so good that everyone wanted a second slice.
words.defineEn: the ability to recognize something with good quality or high standard, especially in art, style, beauty, etc.
words.defineVi: khả năng nhận ra một cái gì đó với chất lượng tốt hoặc tiêu chuẩn cao, đặc biệt là về nghệ thuật, phong cách, vẻ đẹp, v.v.

words.defineEn: used to express that one's decision is definite and cannot be changed
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng quyết định của một người là chắc chắn và không thể thay đổi

words.defineEn: a choice or option that seems less harmful or unpleasant out of two that one is confronted with
words.defineVi: một sự lựa chọn hoặc tùy chọn có vẻ ít gây hại hoặc khó chịu hơn trong số hai lựa chọn mà người ta phải đối mặt

examples: In terms of political agendas and I think over the long term, the energy sector, at least the green space, is going to be a big growth factor.

I think over the long term, what Apple's device actually becomes is a medical device that sort of delivers treatment to patients, which is, I think, really the coolest thing that they could do with their ecosystem.
They think over the sanctions against Russia & Russian counter-sanctions That's not good for them
So I think over time, what you're going to see with charging is essentially it'll become such a seamless thing that most customers won't even have to think about it.
And I think over time, there's increased recognition that these were not good for the environment.
words.defineEn: to consider a matter carefully before reaching a decision
words.defineVi: để xem xét một vấn đề một cách cẩn thận trước khi đạt được một quyết định

words.defineEn: to think about something very carefully before doing it
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó rất cẩn thận trước khi làm nó

words.defineEn: an unclear situation that either of two possibilities have an equal chance of happening
words.defineVi: một tình huống không rõ ràng mà một trong hai khả năng có cơ hội xảy ra như nhau

examples: Oh, that's a toughie.
words.defineEn: a severely difficult situation, problem, or question
words.defineVi: một tình huống khó khăn nghiêm trọng, vấn đề, hoặc câu hỏi

examples: But that would take unanimous consent.
But today's unanimous decision does not address whether that includes salaries for athletes.
There was not a unanimous consent we should do that plan.
The New York Tribune reported, "The unanimous sentiment of the North is indignant resistance."
The articles could be amended, but that required a unanimous vote, so zero amendments were ever passed.
words.defineEn: (of a group) fully in agreement on something
words.defineVi: (của một nhóm) hoàn toàn đồng ý về một cái gì đó

examples: The timing of President Trump's Senate impeachment trial remains undecided.
It's still undecided.
Now he's undecided.
And there were no undecideds.
They were selected from a curated group of people we've been following of undecided voters.
words.defineEn: not yet made a decision or come to a judgment
words.defineVi: chưa đưa ra quyết định hoặc đi đến phán quyết

examples: The coach told his players, a rotten apple injures its neighbors, so I expect each of you to uphold the values of good sportsmanship and teamwork.
The respected judge did not involve himself in minor legal disputes, as the saying goes, eagles never catch flies, but instead focused on upholding the law and maintaining justice.

The editor-in-chief instructed her reporters to uphold journalistic ethics and avoid using language that could be seen as defamatory or discriminatory, reminding them of the proverb a goose quill is more dangerous than a lion's claw.
United Nations judges in The Hague upheld a genocide conviction against former Bosnian Serb military chief Ratko Mladic.
My contribution to music has been upholding the beautiful rhythms and melodies from Africa.
words.defineEn: (particularly of a law court) to state that a previous decision is correct
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là của một tòa án luật) để tuyên bố rằng một quyết định trước đó là chính xác

examples: I gave my verdict.
The jury was unable to reach a verdict.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
The trial has run its course, and the verdict will be announced tomorrow.
Everyone had been holding their breath, waiting for the verdict.
words.defineEn: an official decision made by the jury in a court after the legal proceedings
words.defineVi: một quyết định chính thức được đưa ra bởi bồi thẩm đoàn tại tòa án sau thủ tục pháp lý

examples: That ignited the fire of them versus us.
Pampered millennials versus hard working under banked.
I feel this us versus them thing
So 350 grams versus something that has an aluminum construction and glass on the top.
Consider one matchup: West versus North.
words.defineEn: used to compare or to show contrast between two choices, decisions, etc.
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để so sánh hoặc thể hiện sự tương phản giữa hai lựa chọn, quyết định, v.v.

examples: But a simple majority of the state legislature can override the veto.
The very words suggest committee battles and last-minute vetoes.
The very words suggest committee battles and last-minute vetoes.
If the President vetoes a law, Congress, with a two thirds vote in both houses, can override the veto.
The governor of Kansas vetoed a bill today aimed at barring transgender students from girls sports teams in public schools.
words.defineEn: refusal of or disagreement with something
words.defineVi: từ chối hoặc không đồng ý với một cái gì đó

examples: Still, we kind of like having them around, and they aren’t going to leave of their own volition.
words.defineEn: the faculty to use free will and make decisions
words.defineVi: khoa sử dụng ý chí tự do và đưa ra quyết định

examples: The votes in the swing state may turn the tide in this election.
The committee voted to kill the project.
The motion was passed by 16 votes to 11.
The bill was four votes shy of a majority.
The vote yesterday appears to mark something of a turning point in the war.
words.defineEn: an official choice made by an individual or a group of people in a meeting or election
words.defineVi: một sự lựa chọn chính thức của một cá nhân hoặc một nhóm người trong một cuộc họp hoặc cuộc bầu cử

examples: The votes in the swing state may turn the tide in this election.
The committee voted to kill the project.
The motion was passed by 16 votes to 11.
The bill was four votes shy of a majority.
The vote yesterday appears to mark something of a turning point in the war.
words.defineEn: to formally express one's preference to choose someone for a particular position
words.defineVi: để chính thức thể hiện sở thích của một người để chọn ai đó cho một vị trí cụ thể

examples: We must stand fast and not waver in our commitment to the cause.
The president never wavered.
He has never wavered, he never, never backs down.
I will never waver in that conviction, I promise you.
And BMW has at times appeared to waver in its commitment to electric vehicles.
words.defineEn: to hold back and hesitate due to uncertainty
words.defineVi: để giữ lại và do dự do không chắc chắn

words.defineEn: one who is incapable of making any decisions due to fear or uncertainty, particularly in an election
words.defineVi: một người không có khả năng đưa ra bất kỳ quyết định nào do sợ hãi hoặc không chắc chắn, đặc biệt là trong một cuộc bầu cử

examples: The brain weighs about three pounds.
Congress weighed the pros and cons of the new tax plan.
He spoke very slowly, weighing his words.
He gave evidence to the court, weighing each word as he spoke.
I've been weighing his words all day, trying to figure out what he meant.
words.defineEn: to consider all the possible outcomes and different aspects of something before making a definite decision
words.defineVi: để xem xét tất cả các kết quả có thể và các khía cạnh khác nhau của một cái gì đó trước khi thực hiện một quyết định rõ ràng

words.defineEn: used when a situation reaches a critical point and one must take action in order to deal with it
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi một tình huống đạt đến điểm quan trọng và người ta phải hành động để đối phó với nó

examples: Time will tell whether we made the right decision.
Only time will tell whether Broughton's optimism is justified.
A number of factors decide whether a movie will be successful or not.
In that embarrassment of riches, some people might wonder whether we need another service area at all.
Whether you take the scenic route or the highway, it makes no odds to the length of the journey.
words.defineEn: used to talk about a doubt or choice when facing two options
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói về một sự nghi ngờ hoặc lựa chọn khi đối mặt với hai lựa chọn
